fields.description: As an administrator, I would like to view all Custom fields created for team-managed projects in one place.
fields.summary: Ability to view all Team-managed custom fields in one place.

fields.description:
As a user, I'd like to filter by component under Deployments.
!image-2021-05-13-17-42-50-566.png|width=619,height=324!
fields.summary: Ability to filter by component under Deployments

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, you can have more than one "Done" status, as well as map more than one status to a column on team-managed projects. 

But Jira still considers the last column of the board when completing a sprint, that is, only issues that are on the far right column will be considered as being complete at the end of the sprint. 

h3. Suggestion

Have Jira consider the Done statuses rather than the last column.
fields.summary: Have Jira consider Done statuses rather than the last column when completing a sprint on team-managed projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When clicking into a notification from an issue that is part of a board, if you go back to the board, it'll display as the Only My Issues quick filter is active but this Quick filter is not applied to the board. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Activate the Only My Issues on the board
# Access an email notification from a Jira issue and click on the link
# A Jira ticket will appear. Click to go back to the board

Video:  [^Recording #79.mp4] 

h3. Expected Results
The Only My Issues should be kept

h3. Actual Results
The Only My Issues quick filter is active but this Quick filter is not applied to the board. 

h3. Workaround
Click on Only My Issues twice to apply that Quick Filter
fields.summary: Jira Board shows the Only my Issues active but does not apply that Quick Filter to the board

fields.description:
Enable to show "Sprint scope will be affected by this action." warning in the new issue view when the Sprint value in the Sprint field is updated.

 

*Old Issue view:* Sprint field shows a warning message: "Sprint scope will be affected by this action."

!image-2021-05-13-16-53-00-101.png|width=428,height=89!

 

*New Issueview:* Sprint field gets silently updated

!image-2021-05-13-16-54-05-798.png|width=281,height=126!
fields.summary: Enable warning message in new issueview "Sprint scope will be affected by this action"

fields.description: It would be very useful if you had the ability to delete a previously saved filter from that filter itself! Maybe by adding an additional option to the 'Details' link for that filter called 'Delete'?
fields.summary: Add the ability to delete a filter whilst using that filter, from the 'Details' link

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Advanced Roadmaps with a large number of releases (>750) cause the plan to load slowly.
h3. Expected Results

Plan loads at normal speed
h3. Actual Results

Plan can take a significant amount of time (>20 seconds) to load.
h3. Workaround

Manually removed old releases from the Releases section
fields.summary: Large number of releases slows Advanced Roadmaps loading performance

fields.description:
Whenever data is filtered within an Advanced Roadmap, the progress bars don't respect the filtered changes, and still displays the full scope of the data in the hierarchy.

In order for the *Progress (Issue Count)* feature to be fully useful when narrowing down issues with a filter, that display should change based on what filter is currently being applied to an issue.
fields.summary: Advanced Roadmaps progress bar should respect filtering

fields.description:
When you paste a URL in a comment, you can select if the URL is displayed as, URL, Inline, or card. 

As default Jira selects inline but it could be helpful to add the possibility to change this default configuration.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Add an option to change the URL display type default in comments

fields.description: The control chart does some complex calculations not available with the JQL search, it would be helpful to have an option to get all the issues from the control chart in an advanced search.
fields.summary: Have the option to see all the issues involved in a Control Chart in an advanced search

fields.description:
Hi, 

I'd like to know if it is possible to modify the layout of a Jira page like the one in the attachment. The 2 important parts (the one containing the list of Jira tickets (yellow) and the one containing the description of the Jira ticket (blue)) are not the biggest ones. 

The last one that contains the assignee, reporter, ... and which is really not important to me is really too big. 

To summarize : the yellow area should be increased, the blue one is fine, the red one should be really decreased (and should be maskable). 

Regards. 

Eric Bouyoux.
fields.summary: Modifying the layout of a Jira ticket page.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Clearing the Done column on a team-managed kanban board will hide not only the task but all the subtasks even if they are not done yet.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a team-managed kanban board, a task, and a child subtask.
 # Move the task to the Done column but keep the subtask in the To Do column.
 # Group by subtasks to see the subtask in the To Do column/status.
 # Group by None and click on the action button in the Done column and select *Clear the Done Issue*.
 # The task will disappear as well as the subtask, even if you group by subtasks you will not be able to see it.

h3. Expected Results
When you clear the Done column the subtasks that are not done will still be visible on the board.

h3. Actual Results
All subtasks, including those that are not done will be hidden.

h3. Workaround
If you wish to return the task to the done column and see all the child tasks, change the task status to something other than done and return to done but don't clear the column.
fields.summary: Clearing Done column on team-managed board hides the subtasks that are not done

fields.description: When I add multiple attachments to Jira they are ordered in a seemingly random way. Even if they are named 1.png 2.png 3.png 4.png they do not always stay in that order. As a designer it would be incredibly helpful to easily reorder attachments for my developers so I don't have to delete all of them and upload them one at a time in the backwards order that I want them to appear on the card.
fields.summary: Ability to reorder attachments

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The action to update the FixVersion field to the “next unreleased version” always takes the release at the very bottom of the list and not actually the next release by date.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an automation rule to edit an issue
 # Select the field "FixVersions" to be edited
 # Choose "Next unreleased version" 

h3. Expected Results

This should set the FixVersion of the issue considering the next available release date.

h3. Actual Results

* If you have only 1 version - it will be picked
* If you have more than one version, the release at the very bottom of the list will be picked.

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: "Next unreleased version" always takes the release at very bottom of the list and not actually the next release by date

fields.description:
As a developer, one of the big positive values that I expect to get from a bug tracking system is the ability to find a ticket that may be in another teams backlog or may have been completed some time ago. The JQL search function promises great power in this area, but in practice I find it almost unusable. Why? My firm's Jira installation reports 414 field names, but the dropdown list only lets me see the first ten, from "Additional RCA" to "Assigned Team". And the "Search" box is no such thing. It lets me type the first few letters–but if I don't know the first letters, I can't match on a string in the middle of the name. And I see no obvious way just to see the whole list of available fields, which would at least let me use the browser's Ctrl-F.

I find it very difficult to effectively search the ticket database. This is a serious enough drawback that I would never willingly use Jira on a project if my employer did not require it.
fields.summary: Need a better way to find field names while composing queries

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to create an issue in the Advanced roadmap and save the changes in Jira, we do not see all the fields that we can see in the create issue screen in the normal workflow. We only selective list of fields. (Specifically the fields that are marked "Required" in the field configuration). In a scenario where the required field is specified in the workflow, it will not allow creation of the issue because the field will not appear on the screen.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add fields and make few fields mandatory
 # Go to your plan -> Create an issue
 # Click on "Review changes"
 # You will see a pop-up displaying to only choose the fields that are marked required. 

h3. Expected Results

To see all the fields that are present so that the user can select them (or) if a workflow contains the "field required" validator present, then add thse field to the plan which will help in avoiding this problem.
h3. Actual Results

The field required validator will throw an error while creating issues from plan. We will not be able to edit the field as they won't appear on the screen.
h3. Workaround

Instead of using validators, Make the field "required" in the field configuration.
fields.summary: All the fields are not displayed in Advanced roadmap plan

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The message from Jira is not adequate to the context where the issue was deleted and when we try to access it from the search field, then got “You don’t have access to the issue”.

!search_field.png!

The customer is requesting the message to be changed and I mentioned reporting it in a feature request, but I would like to confirm if a feature request is the most appropriate way of reporting it.

!Screen Shot 2021-05-11 at 10.39.28 am.png!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Delete an issue;
 # Search the deleted issue directly from the search field by the issue key.
 # The message returned is “You don’t have access to the issue”;

h3. Expected Results
 # The message should be more appropriated and complete. “The issue was deleted or is non-existent, or you don’t have access to the issue.”

h3. Actual Results
 # The message returned is “You don’t have access to the issue”;
 # [^Issue_deleted_or_non-existent.mp4]

{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

NA
fields.summary: Message returned when accessing a deleted issue from the search field seems incorrect

fields.description:
Currently, if IP Allowlisting is enabled and a board is set as publicly visible, even if the IP is allowlisted, the board won't be visible. This happens even if the respective filter and project is set as public.

According to [the documenation|https://support.atlassian.com/security-and-access-policies/docs/specify-ip-addresses-for-product-access/]:
{quote}
IP allowlists currently apply to these pages:
* Jira tasks, issues, projects
* Confluence pages and spaces
* Jira administration
* Confluence administration

If users aren't accessing these pages from an IP addresses in the allowlist, they see a message explaining why they don’t have access. Users also won't be able to access that product programmatically via the APIs.
{quote} 

It would be nice to have such option to make these Software elements visible as well.
fields.summary: Enables visibility of Software elements if IP Allowlisting is on and elements are public

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When an issue is commented with another issue key, when trying to link the commented issue with the issue where the comment is added, it does not work. Basically, the smart value : 

{\{comment.body.match(“(AUT-\d+)”)}} does not work. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a rule similar to below : 
!image-2021-05-10-13-27-11-845.png|width=135,height=204!

h3. Expected Results
 * Read the comment and pick only the issue key that is in the comment. 
 * Link the issue in the comment to the commented issue.  

h3. Actual Results

!image-2021-05-10-13-28-03-698.png|width=483,height=77!
h3. Workaround

Workaround is to : 
* Use the following regular expression for the *Link issue* step:
{code}
{{comment.body.match("([A-Z0-9]+-\d+)")}}
{code}
* Not add any other text in the comment except the issue key
* The issue key should not be a hyperlink and it should be a plain text. Eg : XYZ-123 
* The link issue field should contain a smart value as \{{comment.body}}
fields.summary: Automation for Jira : Link issue when an issue key is commented

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Words in the dialog when using shortcut key "." on the board - appear to be lookup values

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# on a board, when an issue is highlighted
# press “.”
# it opens a dialog which contains the lookup/action reference. like: "common.words.operations”.

h3. Expected Results
Dialog box should have meaningful instructions/operations
h3. Actual Results
Dialog box contains the following:
common.words.operations: <issue-key>
issueactions.start.typing
admin.common.words.close

 !image-2021-05-10-10-43-59-870.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Words in the dialog when using shortcut key "." on the board - appear to be lookup values

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Copy from Parent and Epic does not work in the team-managed (Next-gen) project
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create automation in the next-gen project as below
 ** Trigger - Any event.
 ** Condition - Subtask or Story issue type.
 ** Action - Edit issue and copy field from either Parent or Epic as per the case.

h3. Expected Results

Copy from parent or Epic should work
h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
Automation fail with error - Edit issue
Can't find issue to copy from customfield_10144
No fields or field values to edit for issues (could be due to some field values not existing in a given project)
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Use the SmartValue: issue.parent.customfield_<custom_fieldID>

Related AUT Ticket: https://codebarrel.atlassian.net/browse/AUT-2090
fields.summary: Copy from Parent and Epic does not work in the team-managed (Next-gen) project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The preview strings appear to be translated, but the field only accepts the default english values.
{quote}One of my customer has German Language set on his profile and the Jira site. Whenever the user tries to set the value for Original Estimate, it shows below grey text area but if the user inputs the values in that format, it throws a warning and does not save the value. The user would have to give the value  in English format itself. Sorry If i am missing anything.
Any help is greatly appreciated.
{quote}
h3. Steps to Reproduce

NA
h3. Expected Results

Field should show correct preview when using non-English Language
h3. Actual Results

!Screenshot 2021-04-15 at 2.03.51 PM.png|width=429,height=229!
h3. Workaround

None, https://jdog.jira-dev.com/browse/BENTO-9397
fields.summary: Original estimate field shows incorrect preview in different languages

fields.description: We should be able to quickly edit Due Date, Priority type of important fields on Kanban Board like Trello without entering into the issue each time. Similar to add flag, add label
fields.summary: Quick Edits on Kanban Board

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you un-release a version\release in JIRA that has already triggered a Bamboo build and then attempt to re-release electing to trigger a new build in Bamboo, the release will fail indicating that JIRA can't contact Bamboo.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a release in JIRA
# Associate an issue with the release via the fixVersion field
# Commit changes to a repository being synchronized via DVCS including the issue key associated with the release in the commit message
# Create a build plan in Bamboo that uses the same repository
# Release and choose to a trigger a new build in Bamboo
# Unrelease the version\release from the JIRA Releases page via the Actions ellipses menu.
# Release the version again and choose to trigger a new Bamboo build

h3. Expected Results
A new Bamboo build is triggered.

h3. Actual Results
JIRA complains it can't contact Bamboo.
 !Screen Shot 2016-09-16 at 12.31.22 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Workaround
We discovered that this can be fixed by renaming the fix version and also clearing browser cache and relogging on to jira.
fields.summary: Re-releaseing Fails to Trigger New Bamboo Build

fields.description:
Greetings,

as a larger organization, we have a need to have some basic simple same communication language. One area which we are building is the same coloring for EPICs and above to be able to display critical projects that have fixed deliveries. Not all projects have fixed delivery and thus the ones that are critical need to be distinguished from others visually.

We can achieve this now through the same labeling system but each new Plan in AR we build needs to configure this labeling again.

 

Can you build in a shared coloring system? 

Example in shared coloring system:
 * Label: FixedProductDelivery -> Red
 * Label: EndOfSupport -> Yellow

Have such shared labeling would be very helpful as any plan setup would automatically come with this coloring and it would be clear in every single Plan what some deliveries are.

 

Thank you and greetings from Accolade
fields.summary: Shared labels support

fields.description:
Hello,

We can see the total number of story points each user has, but we cannot see the breakdown per status (with colors or something). We CAN see it for the TOTAL number of story points over the whole team at the top of the page. We want the same view for each individual user, please.

Kind Regards,
Jarno
Solution Architect @ DOBIT nv
fields.summary: Individual user his/her story points: add breakdown per status please

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Now we can [use Kanban backlog|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/use-your-kanban-backlog/] by changing the board settings. However, a Sprint date pop-up is shown for a column status.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to Kanban board settings->Column settings and then enable Backlog
 # Under Backlog we can see "Add dates" option which is usually present for Sprints in Scrum backlog.

h3. Expected Results
Remove the "add dates" option for Kanban baclogs

h3. Actual Results
"Add dates" for Sprint option is provided for next status.


h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: On enabling a Kanban backlog , sprint date pop up is shown for the status

fields.description: Sometimes is necessary to separate project permissions, for example, that a user has permissions to edit releases or components but not the issue layout, it would be very helpful to have separated project admin permissions.
fields.summary: Separate permission for issue layout

fields.description:
h3. Problem

In the new issue view, for an attachment, when we right click there is no option to copy the link address as like in the old issue view


h3. Suggested Solution
Please have the same option "copy link address" ,made available to the attachments in the new issue view

h3. Why This Is Important
As of now we can only use an API call to get the Attachment ID and then use this in another API call to get the attachment link address, which makes it difficult.

h3. Workaround
use ?oldIssueView=True to get the copy link address from the attachment to get the complete URL
fields.summary: Ability to copy an attachment link address missing in the new issue view

fields.description:
Is it possible to make all of the attachments in Task, Fault reports etc.. to show the first page in the attachment. Attached pictures shows the picture but not files as Power point and such.

This would make it easier to find the right attached files.
fields.summary: View the attachments by picture.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using Manual trigger with the Branch with JQL, the action specified in the Branch does not apply for the issue where the "Manual trigger" was initiated.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a rule with Manual trigger
 # Add a branch 
 # Choose "JQL" and add the project/query as per your requirement, which will include the issue that you are going to choose for triggering the rule. 
 # Add an action

+*Sample rule snippet :*+

!image-2021-05-06-14-12-39-596.png|width=194,height=234!
h3. Expected Results

All the issue that were looked up on the branch including the issue from where the manual trigger was initiated should be updated
h3. Actual Results

Updates all the issue found by the JQL query except the one that triggered the rule.
h3. Workaround

Using scheduled trigger to find the issues and update accordingly.
fields.summary: Automation for Jira : "Manual trigger" skips the triggered issue when used with Branch

fields.description:
h3. Problem

It's not possible to assign issues with using the shortcut 'a' and List view mode in Advanced issue search. It only works when using Detail view.
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow shortcut 'a' and List view
h3. Why This Is Important

The Detail view may not have have the fields which the user wants and open each issue can takes a while to load.
h3. Workaround

Use Detail view
fields.summary: Can't assign using shortcut 'a' in list view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When setting the Date/Time for custom fields, the only way to save it is to click on the Save icon or somewhere in the new issue view.
h3. Suggested Solution

As per other custom fields, such as Text, add the ability to save it by hitting *Enter* on the keyboard. The old issue view also had such ability.
h3. Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: Allow "Enter to save" on Date/Time custom fields in the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Problem
 The view issue screen does not display the entire time tracking details on the right side of the view issue screen panel. It does not show the remaining, logged and Estimated as in the old issue view.
Please find the attached snapshots.



h3. Suggested Solution
_(Add a suggested solution once one has been determined)_

h3. Why This Is Important
Customer finds it easy to track it, when he adds the time using third party apps like tempo

h3. Workaround
use ?oldIssueView=true
fields.summary: New Issue View does not show the same screen for Time tracking

fields.description:
Ability to merge releases in a nextgen(Team managed) project similar to classic(Company managed) project.

 

*Releases from Classic(Company managed) project*

!image-2021-05-05-18-34-11-331.png|width=362,height=100!

 

*Releases from Nextgen**(**Team* *managed) project*

!image-2021-05-05-18-35-20-445.png|width=386,height=85!
fields.summary: Ability to merge releases in nextgen project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When changing "Permission scheme" on a project, the browser shows "Issue security scheme" is being changed.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Proceed to Associate a different "Permissions scheme" on any project. The information on the browser tab reads : Associate Issue Security Scheme to Project - Jira.
 !Screenshot 2021-05-05 at 3.23.05 PM.png|thumbnail! 

This issue is same across all the browsers. Although a minor inconvenience, it can confuse the users.

This only happens when changing Permission Scheme, for other changes like "Issue type screen scheme", etc, the browser displays correct information as in below example. 

 !Screenshot 2021-05-05 at 3.24.33 PM-1.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When changing "Permission scheme" on a project, the browser shows  that the "Issue security scheme" is being changed.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when defining the scope of a Plan, sub-tasks will not be included on it  unless their parent issues are in its scope. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow users to include sub-tasks on a Plan, even if their parent issues are not on its scope.
fields.summary: Allow sub-tasks to be included in a Plan if its parent is not part of it

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Advanced roadmap, if a user does not have 'Administer Jira' global permission , they cant search for all thee groups. They can only search for groups that they belong to.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Do not grant the user 'Administer Jira' Global permission in Jira.
 # Grant them only 'Browse users and groups' permission.
 # Search for a group in Advanced roadmaps. Navigate to Configure->Access Control, try searching for a group to restrict editing/viewing to a particular group.

h3. Expected Results

User should be able to see all the groups as they have "Browse users and groups" permission. 

 
h3. Actual Results

They can only search for groups that they belong to.
h3. Workaround

Granting them 'Administer Jira' permission helps mitigate the issue.However it may not be feasible workaround for all users.
fields.summary: Users cant search for all the groups in Advanced roadmap if they do not have "Administer Jira' permission.

fields.description:
TLDR. In the new Jira Issue view, the Issue Type is no longer visible in the fields and there is no way to do so.

Details here: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Software-questions/How-to-display-Issue-Type-in-New-Jira-issue-view/qaq-p/1382773]
fields.summary: display Issue Type in New Jira issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Start sprint date field populated with javascript date time format instead of actual date
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Drag and drop some issues from backlog to a new sprint
 # Click on start sprint

h3. Expected Results
!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
  
The start sprint date field should show the current date
 
h3. Actual Results

The start sprint modal shows the javascript date time format instead of the current date
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Contact support for further assistance.
fields.summary: Start sprint date field populated with javascript date time format instead of actual date

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a user language is set to Thailand, setting the end date when starting a sprint does not work.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Visit the lin https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/account-preferences?ref=jira&src=personalsettings
# Set language to Thailand
# Now create a sprint 
# Start the sprint
# Now try to set the end date

h3. Expected Results
The end date should be set

h3. Actual Results
An error is thrown that language is not supported

h3. Workaround
Change the user language setting from Thailand
fields.summary: Can't set sprint end date when personal language is Thailand

fields.description:
It would be helpful to be able to scroll in the Advanced Roadmap view. It's not usable without it. 

 

How are you looking at projects that are 6 months long without being able scroll?
fields.summary: Ability to scroll in Advance roadmap view

fields.description: When configuring the new Jira view there is an option for fields to "Hide When Empty" which is fantastic. It would be greatly beneficial to also have the ability to hide fields when the default is "None", which occurs with most custom fields created.
fields.summary: Hide Fields That Display "None" as Default Value on Issuedetail View

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
It's not possible to remove an archived version from an issue.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a version under *Project* >> *Releases*.
 # Add this version to a field's issue, e.g.: *Affects version*.
 # Back to releases and achieve this version.
 # Back to the ticket and try to remove the version.

 * [*Video with the steps*.|https://share.getcloudapp.com/4gu2WnRQ]

h3. Expected Results

It should be removed or at least show a message that the version cannot be removed because the version is archived.
h3. Actual Results

Without reload the issue, it seems that the label was removed. However, if we reload the issue the version will continue there. Also, nothing will appear under history.
h3. Workaround
 # Access Releases.
 # Filter by archived version.
 # Anarchive the version that needs to be removed.
 # Then, we can remove the version from a ticket.
fields.summary: It's not possible to remove an archived version from an issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When project role is changed for a user, a user can still see the issues on Kanban board which they previously had access to as a part of Issue security.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue security level with 2 levels
 ** Level 1 for project role "administrators"
 ** Level 2 for project role "another_role"
 # Grant yourself to these 2 roles via project people section.
 # Create some issues in the project and set the security level , say "Test-1" to Level 1 and "Test-2" to Level 2.
 # We can now see both the issues on Kanban board, rightly so , as we are part of both the roles.
 # Now, remove yourself from one of the roles, say "another_role". Navigate to the Kanban board.

h3. Expected Results

User should not see the issue card, on the Kanban Board, with security Level 2 , as the user no longer has access to the issue.
h3. Actual Results

User can still see the issue card, with security Level 2 on Kanban Board. _Although_, _when we click on the issue ( from the board) , we cant see the issue details._
h3. Workaround

Moving an issue to the affected column( where the issue card still appears)  triggers a Board column refresh and it disappears from the Board. _Note: JQL works as expected when we run "Project =XYZ" , which return only issues that user has access to._
fields.summary: After changing the user's project role, they can still see the issues which they had access to earlier in Kanban Boards.

fields.description:
h3. Problem
When searching columns, the drop down list of available field/columns only shows you the first few fields. The other fields needs to be typed in

h3. Suggested Solution
In order to quickly add columns, which is suitable, It will be  good to have an option like "load more" columns, so the hidden columns are visible.

h3. Why This Is Important
Don't have to remember the field names and it is easy to pull up looking at the different options available

h3. Workaround
Type in the starting letter of the field to the column field
fields.summary: Unable to view all column fields with JQL search

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Team-Managed projects don't show up who has completed a Sprint, differently from Company-Managed projects that shows it explicitly in the Sprint report. 
h3. Suggested Solution

Add the _"Closed sprint, ended by <user name>"_ in the Sprint report for Team-Managed projects
h3. Why This Is Important

It's important to track who has completed a Sprint.
h3. Workaround

Check in the History section from the issues when/who changed the Sprint. But it will not always mean a "Sprint completed" event in case the user has just moved the issue from Sprint to another without completing it.

Another option is to create an Automation to be triggered when a Sprint is closed for the Team-Managed project and add the following smart value:
{code:java}
{{rule.actor.displayName}}
{code}
And change the rule's actor to "User who triggered the event"
fields.summary: Ability to view in the UI who completed a Sprint in Team-Managed projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In its current state, for Scrum teams, you can configure your Plan to use Sprint dates for unscheduled issues by enabling the "Use sprint dates when issues don't have start and end dates" in the Scheduling settings. There is no equivalent for Kanban teams that uses Releases instead.

 !TST7_KANBAN_-_sprints.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Proposed solution

Add an additional option to "Use release dates when issues don't have start and end dates"  that would allow Kanban teams to utilize this functionality.

 !TST7_KANBAN_-dates.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Use release dates when issues don't have start and end dates

fields.description:
While Business and Next-gen projects have in-place updates (auto refresh) once an issue is changed, Classic Software projects have a refresh button popup.

As a user and board admin, it would be great to have this auto-refresh behavior for Classic Software projects, since it makes the life of all users easier and allows data to keep up-to-date.
fields.summary: Classic Software auto-refresh

fields.description:
When running a single project (for a single product as defined in Scrum and Scaled Scrum Frameworks as good practise) but having multiple teams some reports do not enable you to target individual teams or releases.

 

For example: The below shows a release which only one team has been working on but the data pulled through all the other teams fi !release chart.PNG! gures

 

 

 

Or a velocity chart which does not allow you to drill down to an individual team
fields.summary: Enable accurate reporting when running multiple teams from one JIRA project

fields.description:
The quick filter for assignee shows users who don't have issues that meet the filter conditions to show issue on the boards.

The users show up in the quick filter because they are the assignee of a parent issue that has a child showing on the board.

This is confusing as users expect to see assignee quick filters for users who have an issue that meets the main JQL filter of the board.
fields.summary: Filter by assignee shows parent issue assignee when it should not

fields.description:
1. /board/\{boardid}/issue API returns incorrect issues:

Steps to reproduce the bug:
 - Create a new next-gen type project
 - Turn on the “Backlog” at the project features, but don’t turn on the “Sprints”
 - Create 3 issues in the backlog
 - Add only the first issue to the board (let’s say its id is 2)
 - Call this REST API endpoint: https://<JIRA_BASE_URL>/rest/agile/1.0/board/2/issue
 [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/software/rest/#api-rest-agile-1-0-board-boardId-issue-get]

*Expected Result*

JSON result contains only the first issue.

*Actual Result*

JSON result contains all 3 issues.

------------------------

2. /backlog API not returning resolved issues

Well explained in [https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/jira-software-cloud-get-issues-for-board-rest-api-does-not-return-the-correct-issues-for-boards-of-next-gen-projects/32951/3]

Reference:
 [https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/jira-software-cloud-get-issues-for-board-rest-api-does-not-return-the-correct-issues-for-boards-of-next-gen-projects/32951]
fields.summary: Jira Software Cloud “Get issues for board” REST API does not return the correct issues for boards of next-gen projects

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The user is not able to link an Epic created in a team-managed (formerly next-gen) project with a Story created in a company-managed (formerly classic) project using Epic Link.

h3. Suggested Solution

Enable the functionality so that users can link an Epic created in a team-managed (formerly next-gen) project with a Story created in a company-managed (formerly classic) project using Epic Link.

h3. Why this is important

Enabling this functionality to link the team-managed (formerly next-gen) Epic with company-managed (formerly classic) project story gives the privilege to the usage of the Roadmap feature of the team-managed (formerly next-gen) project to a much better extent.
fields.summary: Provide an ability to link issues of company-managed project to epic of team-managed project

fields.description:
As a Jira User, I want to be able to move Sprint up and down in the backlog using a keyboard shortcut or mouse drag and drop, so that I can organize the sprints faster and save repetitive efforts to move the sprints up and down.

!image-2019-07-24-11-53-12-654.png!

!https://tribedone.org/metric/?mid=&wid=51824&sid=&tid=8404&rid=LOADED&custom1=jira.atlassian.com&custom2=%2Fbrowse%2FJSWCLOUD-6626&t=1563949041761!!https://tribedone.org/metric/?mid=&wid=51824&sid=&tid=8404&rid=FINISHED&custom1=jira.atlassian.com&t=1563949041761!
fields.summary: Shortcut to move Sprint up and down

fields.description:
A complement to issue count, issue count exclude subtasks

I suggest

"issue count, exclude parent"

 
{panel:title=Counted}
*Counted*

an subtask is counted

a issue with no subtask in the same column is counted

a epic with no member issue in the same column is counted
{panel}
{panel:title=Not counted}
epic with member issue in the same column

issue with subtask in the same column.
{panel}
 

This would allow a team to drag an issue in to a step and then work with subtasks.

It would be clear that the issue/epic is worked upon, but it is the smallest element that is counted towards wip limits.
fields.summary: Smart wip limmit issue count

fields.description: As a Product Manager it would be super nice to be able to filter by status in the backlog. For tracking the current sprint I am often toggling between the board and backlog, but would prefer to live in the backlog the majority of the time and track delivery metrics to easily give status updates on certain issues.
fields.summary: Add a status filter to the next-gen backlog

fields.description:
This feature request is for the "Backlog" page.
h4. Use case

It would be very beneficial to be able to do one or both of these:
1) Move a sprint to the top, or
2) Create a sprint directly below the running one(s).

We use sprints to group work packages (because they can be collapsed, which is useful).

Currently, when adding a sprint, it is always added on the bottom.
So we have to click "Move Sprint up" 10 times or so, which is annoying.

 
h4. Suggested UI

1) "Move sprint to top" should be added to this menu:

!image-2019-07-31-08-30-25-261.png!

2) "Create sprint" button should also be available on top of the Backlog page.
This button should then create a sprint directly below the running one(s).
fields.summary: Add actions "Move sprint to top" and "Create Sprint below running one"

fields.description:
I'm opening a suggestion behalf a customer of ours:

Give appropriate view for ranked issues without subtasks in a board when is split by stories swimlanes.

Today, even when it have issues without subtasks with bigger rank than others with subtasks, these issues are putting at the bottom of the page, in the "other issues" section.

And, this makes impossible users to understand the priority into an active sprint, without consulting the backlog obligatorily.
fields.summary: Correct viewing of ranked Issues without tasks in active sprints.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Quick filters show no description on hovering the mouse pointer for Classic Project Boards
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Hover the mouse pointer over any quick filter from a Classic Project Board

h3. Expected Results
Popup the Description field from the Quickfilter created details
h3. Actual Results
There is no message that pops up hovering the mouse pointer

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Quick filters show no description on hovering the mouse pointer for Classic Project Boards
When wrong element is set in filter, Epic Link and Version values are not automatically set through inline creation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Transition between Kanban Boards fails due to rendering of a popup

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a board having >20 issues in a column.
# Wait for the popup to be loaded (This may not come since if the user has once closed this popup, it won't be shown unless user keeps on transitioning on the boards).
# Transition to another board.

h3. Expected Results
The board loads correctly.

h3. Actual Results
The board is blank.

h3. Workaround
Refresh the board.
fields.summary: Transition between Kanban Boards fails due to rendering of a popup

fields.description:
Hello,

In Jira, in the sidepanel, near the bottom, it says "You're in a company-managed project." This feels unnecessarily aggressive. Would it be possible to remove it, or make its display optional? Thank you!

Screenshot:

!image-2021-04-20-17-05-55-019.png!
fields.summary: Remove "You're in a company-managed project" notice

fields.description: As a user, I would like to be able to select any sprint from the dropdown menu of a team-managed report (i.e. Burnup report, Sprint burndown chart). Currently, it's only possible to select one of the last 10 sprints.
fields.summary: Show all sprints on Team-Managed reports

fields.description: I realise that we should know what we are doing, but too often I need to go through painful move to different parent process.  A drag and drop into different parent will be great.
fields.summary: Drag Sub-task to different story/parent

fields.description: Jira requires so much scrolling and shows you only a few stories at a time. Please provide at least a way for each user to choose his/her own compactness setting.
fields.summary: More compact board / less wasted space / less scrolling / better overview

fields.description:
As of today, I can assign card colors based on a number of criteria including work item type, assignee, or arbitrary JQL queries.  However, the color only applies to the left hand edge of the card.

In many cases, I prefer to see a background color across the entire card.    The Ascend Card Colors plugin enables this capability for Jira Server and Data Center, but it does not work the same way for Cloud.    Perhaps there is a missing API or something.

In my opinion this is a capability that should be built in to Jira, as it is in most other Kanban or Scrum tools.   In fact, it would be great if there were a set of 6 or 8 pre-set pastel colors available for use.   You have to use very pale pastels otherwise the color is annoying and overwhelming, and in my experience it takes hours to pick all the perfect colors.   So Atlassian could save us tons of time and aggravation by putting this capability into the tool.

There could be a checkbox:  

___ apply colors to left hand edge of card

___ apply colors to the entire card background

BTW, we know that this capability is possible, because a cards is colorized in yellow if flagged = impediment is set on a card.   All we are suggesting is to generalize this existing capability!
fields.summary: As a cloud user, I would like to be able to apply background colors to the full card width on the board, so that I can improve visibility

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary:

Inconsistency when using Deutsche language.

This creates confusion as to what to filter when using a filter.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1: Ensure that the Account preference language is selected as Deutsche.
 # Step 2: Check out the default field config and search for Labels, we do find the field name as it is.
 # Use a filter and try searching for the keyword "Labels", we do not have this keyword in the filter option. The word has changed to " Stichwort "

h3. Expected Results:

Either it should have been "Labels" in the filter as well as the fields section or it should have been "Stichwort " in both the places.
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround:

Select the language to English in Account preferences.

Goto the filter and use the option "labels", keep this page as it is.

Change the language to Deutshe in a different browser.

Refresh the filter page, you will get the name German translation for Labels as "Stichwort"

We can probably use the same steps for some other words, in case we are unable to relate the fields and the option in filter.
fields.summary: Inconsistency with Detsche language

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement:

Team-managed projects consider issues as not done or completed if the DONE status is not mapped to the last (rightmost) column on the board even though there are other columns with the status "Done".
  
h3. Suggested Solution:

Would be nice if the ‘Done’ is based on a status category and not column position when having multiple columns with Done status.
h3. Why this is important

As it's now possible to have multiple done status (JSWCLOUD-17497) on team-managed projects, adding one more column as Done doesn't actually consider it as complete.
fields.summary: Update Sprint Logic where 'Done' is based on a status category

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you exclude certain issue type under Exclusion rules, this issue type still appears under the Filter > Issue Types dropdown menu.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Plan configuration > Exclusion rules > Exclude issue types
 !1.png|thumbnail! 
# Select the issue type you want to exclude com your plan
# Go back to Plan
# From the Filter dropdown menu, expand the Issue Types option
# You still see the excluded issue type as option.
 !2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Excluded issue types won't show as option under the Filter dropdown menu.

h3. Actual Results
You still see the excluded issue type as option.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Excluded issue types from plan still appear under Filter dropdown menu

fields.description:
*Problem:*

A recent update to cloud-hosted Jira now automatically attempts to resolve URL links and when successful it will replace the actual text of the URL with an clickable text link of the website's title and favicon.  

Clicking on this "enhanced" link offers a new menu with 3 display options: 
 * Display URL  (the previous default behavior)
 * Display Inline (the new default behavior)
 * Display Card

This is problematic for those of us that always need to display the actual URL.  While each instance can be resolved with two clicks, this can add significant work when multiple URLs are involved. 

*Suggestion:*

Give users the ability to set a preference for the default behavior of this functionality.  

 

*Steps to Replicate:*

This functionality appears both in the editor for issues and the editor for comments on issues.
 * Type in a URL such as [https://www.w3.org|https://www.w3.org/] . (Note the URL must be accessible to Jira - a public website.)
 * The URL will be automatically replaced by the favicon and website title.

To get the previous behavior (to show the actual URL), you must take the following extra steps:
 * Right click on the website title and a dropdown will appear.  
 * From the dropdown which has "Display Inline" currently selected, choose "Display URL".

 

Thank you for your consideration.
fields.summary: Create user preference for default behavior of URL "display inline" function

fields.description:
In the new issue view, it is no longer available groups by sections on the right-side column:

!8c678859-1fb8-4464-845e-b12af9a3dac0.gif|width=629,height=381!
h4. Why This Is Important
_It groups fields by theme in issue view, adding another level of organization. It was available as default before and could become an optional addition to the new issue view._ 
h4. Workaround
_No workaround is available._
fields.summary: Enable section groups in new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
User with browse project permission role can access project deployment configuration and modify deployment options by pasting URL to browser.
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Log in as a user without Administer Projects permission
 # Paste URL to the browser:https://<your_site>.atlassian.net/jira/software/c/projects/<your_project>/settings/deployments.
 # Enable/disable deployments

h3. Expected Results
Users with browse project permission should not be able to navigate to deployments settings unlike Project Administrator.

h3. Actual Results
User with browse permission can change deployment configuration settings. Please find the attached video for more details.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Users without Administer Project permission can access and enable deployments for project

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Non licensed users are reflecting in the assignee field when user navigates to search issues filter. 
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow only the licensed active users in the assignee field when user navigates to search issues filter. 

Navigation: Click on search --> Advanced issue search --> Click on Assignee dropdown --> non licensed users are selectable in this filter.

h3. Workaround 
N/A
fields.summary: Assignee field should populate only licensed users when we perform advanced search filters

fields.description:
In the old issue view, when typing in an autocomplete field (like Labels or Fix Versions) you could begin typing your value and use the down arrow keys to select the option offered, press enter to apply it to the field, and then press enter again to save your selection and exit the field entry. However in the New Issue View, performing the same actions ends up adding undesired selections to your field since pressing enter without specifically selecting an option will add the top suggestion to your field. There does not seem to be any way that you can exit the field and save your selections without using the mouse to click out of the field.

 

This makes data entry in the New Issue View more complicated, and often results in values added to these fields that are undesired.

Example:
fields.summary: Auto-Suggest field renderer in New Issue View should be saved/exited with Enter Key

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The only way we can allow JSM users to access the JSW boards by making the projects public in the internet.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow customers viewing the boards the same way they access confluence KBs without licenses.
 
h3. Workaround 
N/A
fields.summary: Allow JSM customers to view JSW boards

fields.description:
We propose a new Korean translation of "Cannot Reproduce" among the data setting values of "Resolution" that you enter when changing the status of an issue to resolved.

 

Currently, the translation "Cannot Reproduce" "복제 불가" is not natural.

Request a translation as "재현 불가".
fields.summary: Request for correction of errors in Korean translation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unable to create Next-gen projects when the context for the field Flagged is not global
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Restrict the context of Flagged field to some projects/issue types
 # Try creating a new Next-gen project

h3. Expected Results

The project is created
h3. Actual Results

The project creation fails

h3. Workaround

Add a new context to the field that is available for all projects and all issue types
fields.summary: Unable to create Next-gen projects when the context for the field Flagged is not global

fields.description:
*Summary:*
 The JIRA Agile column configuration screen does not properly identify the statuses which belong to the board when the conditions below are met:
 # There is an issue type using a custom workflow, with different statuses, AND
 # The JQL filter used by the Board references the issue type above, OR
 ** e.g. Using the filter {{project = P AND issuetype = custom_type OR project = P}} will cause this problem, even though it should return the same results as the filter '_project = P_'.
 # The JQL filter used by the board reference to text
 ** e.g Using the filter {{project = P AND text ~ "testtext"}}

The problem happens when the project/board is configured in such a way that it has multiple workflows (for different issue types). The board seems to only consider the statuses from the first workflow listed under its workflow scheme. The other statuses from the rest of workflow in the same workflow scheme will have a warning triangle indicating that the board doesn't recognize them. The yellow triangle icon states "{color:#ffbdad}This status is not available in any of the workflows used by this board{color}"

_This is similar to JSWSERVER-11623, rather the customer issue for this bug was resolved via referencing the same. Opening this bug to track the issue for cloud ._

 

*Steps to Reproduce:*

*Refer the steps in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-11623*

*Workaround*
 Using the sample filter above
 * {{project = P AND issuetype = custom_type OR project = P}} and changing it to {{project = P AND issuetype = custom_type OR project = P and issuetype in (standardIssueTypes(),subTaskIssueTypes())}}, which yields the same results seems to resolve the problem.
 * {{project = P AND text ~ "testtext"}} is to be changed to {{project = P AND text ~ "testtext" AND issuetype in (standardIssueTypes(),subTaskIssueTypes())}}

 

_In customer's case the filter was : {color:#00875a}project = GI AND ("Epic Link" = GI-2 OR issuekey = GI-2) ORDER BY Rank ASC{color} . The statuses were in warning for filter {color:#00875a}Epic Link = GI-2{color}** and {color:#00875a}issuekey = GI-2{color} ** statuses were without any warning._ _T_

_The issue was resolved after changing the filter to {color:#00875a}project = GI AND ("Epic Link" = GI-2 OR issuekey = GI-2) and issuetype in (standardIssueTypes(),subTaskIssueTypes()) ORDER BY Rank ASC{color}_
fields.summary: Agile Board Column Configuration Missing Statuses

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a user visits the -Kanban- backlog page and clicks on an issue, the right section where all the details should be shown is blank. This behavior is random, and sometimes if you reload the page it will display the details section correctly. If you use shift + reload (cmd + R) it will show the details section correctly.

So far this happens with Firefox v87 and v88 ( seen this behaviour in Chrome as well, but very rarely)

Video is attached

I'm editing this issue since one user has reported this behavior on a Scrum Board as well.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1 Visit the Kanban backlog page.
 # Step 2 Click on any issue.

h3. Expected Results

View issue screen should be shown in the right panel.
h3. Actual Results

Blank section
h3. Workaround

use shift + reload (cmd+R)
fields.summary: Loading an issue in backlog  shows blank section for details

fields.description:
h3. Problem :

A user who has site access but no product access :

!image-2021-04-23-12-28-59-775.png|width=206,height=151!

when tries to login to the instance receives a misleading error message like below :

  !image-2021-04-23-12-30-27-918.png|width=367,height=154!
h3. Suggested Solution :

Display the message stating that the user does not have to product and could contact administrator for access.

 
h3. Workaround
fields.summary: Provide meaningful error message when user with no product access tries to login to the site.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When using a team managed (previously known as next-gen) kanban style project, the only way to move issues from the backlog and into the board is to either click and drag that issue into the board section, or right click/use the ellipsis (...) in order to select the 'Move to board' option.

Furthermore when an issues is moved from backlog to board, no issue fields on the issue are uniquely changed here (aside from possibly Rank).  Whereas in Company managed Kanban, when an issues moves from backlog to board, the status of that issue changes.

There are no other locations in Jira where you can change what appears on that Team managed kanban board.


h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great if there was some kind of flag that would appear on the issue data itself to help determine what issues are on the board vs which issues are in the backlog.  This could then be an issue field that Automation could set when certain conditions are met.  This could be a new custom field, or even if the backlog was a separate status that would then change when the issue is moved to appear on the board.


h3. Why this is important
Customers want to be able to automatically shift issues onto the board.  This is possible to do in Company managed projects because a status changes.  This is also possible in Team Managed Scrum, because these can use the sprint field in order to set a value in order to make sure it appears on the board.
But this is not currently possible to do in team managed kanban projects.


h3. Workaround 
One way to use automation to move issues from backlog to board is to enable the Sprints feature for this project.  This then gives each issues in that project a sprint field that can be set.  Automation can then be configured to Edit the issue and set a value for that sprint field.  When an issue gains a value to that field, this also makes it appear on the board instead of the backlog view only.
fields.summary: I want to be able to use automation in order to move issues from backlog to board in a Team managed Kanban board

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When accessing a live plan and edit the issue source, the alignment of the content is cluttered. 

!image-2021-04-22-20-56-42-204.png|width=138,height=228!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go your live plan 
 # click on Configure -> Issue sources
 # Click on "Edit sources" 
 # You will see the cluttered display

h3. Expected Results

The page aligned
h3. Actual Results

!image-2021-04-22-20-57-33-143.png|width=132,height=218!
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Live plans : Improper alignment when editing issue source

fields.description:
Currently the only valid locations for a board are:
* classic project
* personal

If I'd like to have more than one board for a next gen project I'd need to either migrate to a classic one (overkill) or have it defined on my personal space (which is strange for a board that's going to be used by the team).

I'd like to be able to either have secondary boards on next gen projects or be able to move them to the team space instead of the personal one.
fields.summary: I'd like to be able to create boards in either next gen projects or teams

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you add a Agile Wallboard gadget to a dashboard and map this gadget to a scrum board which has an Active Sprint and the swimlanes of this board are configured by Stories, the gadget will fail to load/render the first issue of that board.

The following video better demonstrates this problem:

 [^JRACLOUD-73032.mp4] 

*Update 1*: This appears to be a front-end related bug:

 [^JRACLOUD-73032-2.mp4] 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add an "Agile Wallboard" gadget to a Dashboard;
# Map a scrum board with an Active Sprint to this gadget;
# Make sure the "Swimlanes" on this board are configured by Stories.

h3. Expected Results
All Stories appears on the Agile Wallboard gadget.

h3. Actual Results
The first issue will fail to load/render in the gadget.

h3. Workaround
Although we understand that this isn't the best workaround, access the board and extend the first issue, then access the relevant dashboard.
fields.summary: Agile Gadget not showing first issue of sprint if swimlanes are configured by Stories

fields.description: In Jira, we need the ability to Disable *Team-managed* projects for all Jira users, including admins.
fields.summary: Ability to disable team-managed project

fields.description:
Use Case : When a Jira issue is transitioned (according to workflow), we'd like to have an automation to automatically approve a pull request in Bitbucket Cloud. 

Currently : If the Pull Request URL is hard coded under "Actions > Send web request", in automation, it works as expected. 

However, the pull request data can't be obtained using smart values within the automation. 

This is a suggestion to expose the pull request information within the automation via smart values in order to achieve the mentioned use case. 

Thank You
fields.summary: Ability to obtain Pull Request Smart Values within automation when an issue is transitioned

fields.description:
I've come back to Jira again after a few years and surprised to see the term "issues" still used when referring to 'tasks' or 'projects'. I understand that issues suits developers etc and is part of the lexicon, however I've had to use Jira in two different companies in creative and marketing teams and the word 'issues' doesn't make any sense to the teams and sounds negative and confusing.

There should be an option to customise what 'issue' sections are called to suit the team that is working in it.
fields.summary: Change title "Issues".

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Next-Gen - Ability to sort the list of Epics Alphabetically or by Project-key (ASC, DESC), when changing the Parent of an issue.

Right now the recently accessed Epics are suggested first in the list as seen below:

 !Screenshot 2021-04-21 at 8.44.14 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Next-Gen - Ability to sort the list of Epics Alphabetically or by Project-key, when changing the Parent of an issue.

fields.description:
{panel:title=(i) Bug Fix Policy| borderStyle=| borderColor=| titleBGColor=#e0efff| bgColor=}
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for the fix to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes bugfixes.
You can learn more by reading [Atlassian Cloud Bug Fixing Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-cloud-bug-fixing-policy-206865884.html].

{panel}

h3. Issue Summary

GHE integration doesn't work.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to DVCS
 # Try connecting to GitHub Enterprise

h3. Expected Results

GHE integration works.

h3. Actual Results

GHE integration doesn't work:

* Customers with GitHub Enterprise would not be able to see new GitHub commits, branches & PRs within Jira
* New GitHub enterprise accounts cannot be set up

h3. Workaround

Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: GitHub Enterprise integration is broken

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Header-bar Search Field is not retrieving configuration from the look-and-feel styling settings
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure the *Look and Feel* screen to the following:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The Search field should show the word *Search* in the same format as the others
h3. Actual Results
It remains under the default system color and unable to view it
h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Header-bar Search Field is not retrieving configuration from the look-and-feel styling settings

fields.description:
h3. Problem Summary

In the old interface of Advanced Roadmaps, it was possible to edit the *Description* field of an issue after clicking on the issue key which would bring up a side panel including this field.

!OLD_-_Advanced_Roadmaps_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Proposed solution

In the new interface, clicking on an issue opens the full issue details view in Jira in a new tab which doesn't allow for a quick edit to the *Description* field. This behavior should only occur when clicking on the Issue key, clicking elsewhere should bring a pop-up or side view where you can edit the field directly in the Plan.
fields.summary: Edit the description field in your Plan

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Attempting to create a Team-managed/Next-gen when having a language different than English

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In a Jira Server/Data Center: translate fields to a language different than English.
# Migrate from Jira server/Data Center to Cloud.
# Set the language of the user account to the language that the fields were translated to in the Server instance.
# Attempt to create a Team managed/Next-gen project.

h3. Expected Results
The project is created.

h3. Actual Results
An error is thrown and the project is not created:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Set the language to English to create the project.
fields.summary: Attempting to create a Team-managed/Next-gen when having a language different than English

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When release notes are edited and configured, they are not saved. It resets back to the default

h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Go to project
 # Click Releases
 # Add a new release or click on an existing release
 # Click release notes
 # Edit the release note text
 # Click "Configure release notes"
 #  Select version and style
 # Click Create

h3. Expected Result
The changes made should be updated.

h3. Actual results
Nothing happens, it goes back to the default text.

h3. Workaround
currently none
fields.summary: Release notes cant be saved

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Customer would like to disable "Code" feature on the team-managed (formerly next-gen) projects and that should hide the Development panel too and not just the Tab "Code"
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to any team-managed (formerly next-gen) project.
 # Disable "Code" feature on the project and check if the development panel is still visible.

h3. Expected Results

Customer would want to have the development panel hidden when the code feature is disabled so that users are confused looking at the panel.
h3. Actual Results

Code feature only disables the "Code" Tab under Project configuration.
h3. Workaround

The only option is to disable the complete DVCS integration (_which is not a feasible option_).
fields.summary: Disabling "Code" feature on team-managed (formerly next-gen) project should hide "Development panel"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Sub-filter for assignee on Kanban board is showing weird behavior. If we apply a sub-filter specifying some assignees, some issues disappear from the board after a few minutes on the active board.

(i) It seems that applying the field assignee on the filter query is happening the same issue.

Reproducing the problem:  [^boardSubFilterBug.mp4] (Please, see at 1'44'')

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a kanban board
 # Apply a sub-filter including a few assignees like below:
{code}
assignee in (name1, name2)
{code}
 # Access the board

h3. Expected Results
All issues are displayed and remain there
h3. Actual Results
A "random" issue disappears from the board after a few minutes on the board's page.

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Subfilter or filter for assignee is vanishing a random issue from the board

fields.description: Would be very helpful if you could allow the user to bookmark/favorite agile boards.
fields.summary: Allow Favoriting/Book Marking Agile boards just like dashboards

fields.description: when you go to your Epic Panel, in Backlog, you see all the Epics. Should have a way (like a dropdown or a selection box) to filter only by the epics that you desire to see or work at that moment.
fields.summary: feature to filter Epics in Epic panel

fields.description: Place an Assignee column to the right of the Epic Summary column in the Roadmap view, thus immediately allowing users to do some level of capacity planning.
fields.summary: Add Assignee column to Roadmap view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When we click on the assignee field for an issue in an Advanced Roadmap plan, the drop-down will show all the users. Ideally, only the users with Assignable User permission for that issue should show up.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a plan with some project issues in it.
 # Pick any issue and click on the assignee column for it.
 # You will notice that those users who lack Assignable user permission will also show up in the list
 # Screen recording attached

h3. Expected Results

User with assignable user permission should show up in the list and once assigned, re-click on the assignee field for the same issue displays the wrong user name.
h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
All users are showing up{noformat}
h3. Workaround

No workaround available
fields.summary: Advanced Roadmaps plan do not respect project permissions while an issue is assigned from a plan

fields.description:
We know that managing user groups as a Jira administrator is a nightmare.

Groups are always changing due to new joiners, leavers and transition between teams.

However, Jira already has all of the information it needs to know who should belong in which group.

My suggestion is that admins should be able to set up automated user group management, for example:

1) I could program user group [x] to always include people who have open issues assigned to them in projects labelled [y]

2) I could program user group [m] to always include people who have the project roles Project Lead and Project Authority in projects labeled [n]

This feature would save huge amounts of time, AND managing permissions based on user groups would become reliable (right now it is not because keeping user groups accurate is too difficult).

Thank you,

Lucy

(Side note: The mandatory 'Components' field has too few options - I can rarely find an appropriate component for my suggestion and there is no 'Blank/Other' option (: )
fields.summary: Automated User Groups
